en: Then shall the kingdom of heaven be likened unto ten virgins, who took their lamps, and went forth to meet the bridegroom.
hmr: “Chu pha chun, vân ram chu nunghâk inthieng sâwm, an khâwnvar chawia, mo neitu tuok dinga suokhai le chun, tekhi ni tâng a tih.

en: And five of them were foolish, and five were wise.
hmr: Anni lai chun panga an var a, panga an invêt a.

en: For the foolish, when they took their lamps, took no oil with them:
hmr: Ân vêthai chun an khâwnvarhai an chawiin a tui an chawisa si nawh a.

en: but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.
hmr: A varhai ruok chun an khâwn- vartui bûrhaiah a tui thunin, khâwn- varhai leh an chawi a.

en: Now while the bridegroom tarried, they all slumbered and slept.
hmr: Chun, mo neitu chu a hung intak leiin, an rêngin an lo inlusuh a, an lo in tah a.

en: But at midnight there is a cry, Behold, the bridegroom! Come ye forth to meet him.
hmr: Chun, zân rila chun, ‘Ngai ta u, mo neitu chu a hung ie! a tuok dingin hung suok ro khai,’ tiin khêkri a hung um tah a.

en: Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps.
hmr: Chu phingle chun nunghâk inthienghai chu an tho vawng a, an khâwnvarhai chu an siemrêl a.

en: And the foolish said unto the wise, Give us of your oil; for our lamps are going out.
hmr: Chun, ân vêthai chun a varhai kuomah, ‘In khâwnvartui kha mi pe ro, kan khâwnvarhai a thi ding a nih,’ an ta.

en: But the wise answered, saying, Peradventure there will not be enough for us and you: go ye rather to them that sell, and buy for yourselves.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a varhai chun, ‘Keini le nangni ta dingin indai naw ni; a zawrtuhai kuomah fe unla, inchaw lem ro,’ tiin an dawn a.

en: And while they went away to buy, the bridegroom came; and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage feast: and the door was shut.
hmr: Chun, inchaw dinga an fe hmang kâr chun, mo neitu chu a hung tlung tah a; chuongchun, ân zohai chu ama le chun inneina ruoi fa dingin an lût a; chun, kawt chu an khâr tah a.

en: Afterward came also the other virgins, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun, nunghâk inthieng danghai khawm chu an hung tlung a, ‘Pu, pu, mi hawngpêk rawh,’ an ta.

en: But he answered and said, Verily I say unto you, I know you not.
hmr: Ama ruok chun, ‘Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, ka hriet naw cheu a nih,’ a ta, a dawn a.

en: Watch therefore, for ye know not the day nor the hour.
hmr: Chuongchun, ngaiven ro, a ni le a hun chu in hriet si nawh a.

en: For it is as when a man, going into another country, called his own servants, and delivered unto them his goods.
hmr: “Vân ram chu mi ram danga fe tâwma, ama suokhai koa, a sumhai an kuoma inkawltir ang chu a ni sih a.

en: And unto one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one; to each according to his several ability; and he went on his journey.
hmr: Suok pakhat kuomah talent nga a pêk a, suok dang kuomah talent hni, suok dang kuomah talent khat: an thaw thei tâwk ding ang sengin a pêk a; chuongchun, a fe tah a.

en: Straightway he that received the five talents went and traded with them, and made other five talents.
hmr: Chun, talent nga dawngtu chu chuonghai chun a va sumdâwng nghâl tah a, talent nga dang a sukdawk tah a.

en: In like manner he also that received the two gained other two.
hmr: Chuong ang bawkin talent hni dawngtu khawm chun talent hni dang a sukdawk tah a.

en: But he that received the one went away and digged in the earth, and hid his lord’s money.
hmr: Talent khat dawngtu ruok chu a va feh a, hnuoi a cho a, a pu tangka chu a thup hmang ta lem a.

en: Now after a long time the lord of those servants cometh, and maketh a reckoning with them.
hmr: “Chun, sâwttak hnungah chuong suokhai pu chu a hung a, an kuomah a sum chanchin a sukfel a.

en: And he that received the five talents came and brought other five talents, saying, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me five talents: lo, I have gained other five talents.
hmr: Chuongchun, talent nga dawng- tu chu a hung a, talent nga dang a hung chawi a, ‘Pu, nangin talent nga i mîn kawltir kha en ta, talent nga dang ka sukdawk,’ a ta.

en: His lord said unto him, Well done, good and faithful servant: thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will set thee over many things; enter thou into the joy of thy lord.
hmr: A pu chun a kuomah, ‘Suok ṭha le ringum, i thaw ṭha ie! tlâwmte chungah ring i um a, tamtak chungah inumtir ka ti che, i pu lâwmnaah lût rawh,’ a ta.

en: And he also that received the two talents came and said, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me two talents: lo, I have gained other two talents.
hmr: Chun, talent hni dawngtu khawm chu a hung a, ‘Pu, nangin talent hni i mîn kawltir kha, en ta, talent hni dang ka sukdawk,’ a ta.

en: His lord said unto him, Well done, good and faithful servant: thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will set thee over many things; enter thou into the joy of thy lord.
hmr: A pu chun a kuomah, ‘Suok ṭha le ringum, i thaw ṭha ie! tlâwmte chungah ring i um a, tamtak chungah inumtir ka ti che; i pu lâwmnaah lût rawh,’ a ta.

en: And he also that had received the one talent came and said, Lord, I knew thee that thou art a hard man, reaping where thou didst not sow, and gathering where thou didst not scatter;
hmr: “Chun, talent khat kawltu khawm chu a hung a, ‘Pu, mi ti kher kher i nih ti ka hriet che; i tu nawnaa khawm i sîk hlak a, i the dar nawnaa khawm în khâwm hlak a nih;

en: and I was afraid, and went away and hid thy talent in the earth: lo, thou hast thine own.
hmr: Chuongchun, ka ṭi a, ka fe a, i talent kha hnuoiah ka thup hmang a, en ta, i ta ngai kha i hmu nâwk hi,’ a ta.

en: But his lord answered and said unto him, Thou wicked and slothful servant, thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not, and gather where I did not scatter;
hmr: A pu chun a kuomah, ‘Suok suol le zawmthawpa, ka itu nawnaa khawm ka sîka, ka the dar nawnaa khawm kân khâwm ti i hriet maw?

en: thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the bankers, and at my coming I should have received back mine own with interest.
hmr: Chuong a ni sa chun, ka tangka chu sumdâwngtuhai kuomah lo sie ding i ni ta an nâwm; chuongchun, ka hung nâwk hin ka ta hi a pung leh ka hmu nâwk ding a nih.

en: Take ye away therefore the talent from him, and give it unto him that hath the ten talents.
hmr: Chuongchun, a talent khat kha lâkpêk unla, talent sâwm neitu kuomah pe ro.

en: For unto every one that hath shall be given, and he shall have abundance: but from him that hath not, even that which he hath shall be taken away.
hmr: Tukhawm a nei taphawt chu pe sâng an ta, chuongchun, hau a tih, tukhawm, a nei naw phawt chu a nei sun khawm chu lâkpêk an tih.

en: And cast ye out the unprofitable servant into the outer darkness: there shall be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.
hmr: Chun, suok ṭhahnem naw kha tuol tieng inthima chun pei dawk ro; chutaka chun ṭap le harâwt chu um a tih,’ a ta, a dawn a.

en: But when the Son of man shall come in his glory, and all the angels with him, then shall he sit on the throne of his glory:
hmr: “Mihriem naupa ruok chu a vântirkohai po po leh a ropuinaa inthuoma a hung phâ chun, a ropuina ṭhungphaah ṭhung a ta;

en: and before him shall be gathered all the nations: and he shall separate them one from another, as the shepherd separateth the sheep from the goats;
hmr: a hmaa chun hnam tin in- khâwm an tih; berâm chingtuin kêl laia a berâmhai a ṭhe angin anni rawi chu ṭhêng a ta;

en: and he shall set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.
hmr: berâmhai chu a changtieng sieng a ta, kêlhai ruok chu a vawi tieng sieng a tih.

en: Then shall the King say unto them on his right hand, Come, ye blessed of my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world:
hmr: “Chu phâ chun, Laltak chun a changtienga mihai kuomah, ‘Ka Pa vochuomhai, hung unla, khawvêl siem tîra inthawka, in ta dinga ram buotsai chu chang ro;

en: for I was hungry, and ye gave me to eat; I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink; I was a stranger, and ye took me in;
hmr: ka phîng a ṭâmin nangnîn fâk ding in mi pêk a, ka dang a chârin dâwn ding in mi pêk a; mikhuol ka niin in mîn tlung tir a;

en: naked, and ye clothed me; I was sick, and ye visited me; I was in prison, and ye came unto me.
hmr: saruok ka niin puon in mîn siltir a; ka damnawh a, in mi kan a, intâng inah ka umin in hung sih a,’ la tîng a tih.

en: Then shall the righteous answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee hungry, and fed thee? or athirst, and gave thee drink?
hmr: “Chu phâ chun, mi felhai chun, ‘Lalpa, iengtik âm phîngṭâmin kan hmu che a, fâk ding kan pêk che? dangchârin kan hmu chea dâwn ding kan pêk che?

en: And when saw we thee a stranger, and took thee in? or naked, and clothed thee?
hmr: Iengtik âm mikhuolin kan hmu che a kan intlungtir che? saruokin kan hmu chea puon kan insiltir che?

en: And when saw we thee sick, or in prison, and came unto thee?
hmr: Iengtik âm damnawin amanih, intâng ina manih kan hmu chea i kuomah kan hung?’ tiin la dawn an tih.

en: And the King shall answer and say unto them, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye did it unto one of these my brethren, even these least, ye did it unto me.
hmr: Chun, Laltak chun an kuomah, ‘Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, hieng ka unau chîntakhai laia mi pakhat chunga in thaw chu, ka chunga thaw in nih,’ tîn la dawn a tih.”

en: Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into the eternal fire which is prepared for the devil and his angels:
hmr: “Chu zoa chun a vawitienga mihai kuoma khawm chun, ‘ṭawng- sephurhai, kumkhuo mei diebol le a tirkohai ta dinga an buotsaia chun mi fe hmangsan ro;

en: for I was hungry, and ye did not give me to eat; I was thirsty, and ye gave me no drink;
hmr: ka phîng a ṭâmin nangnîn fâk ding in mi pêk nawh a; ka dang a chârin nangnîn dâwn ding in mi pêk nawh a,

en: I was a stranger, and ye took me not in; naked, and ye clothed me not; sick, and in prison, and ye visited me not.
hmr: mikhuol ka niin in mîn tlungtir nawh a, saruok ka niin puon in mîn siltir nawh a; damnaw le intâng ina ka umin in mi kan si nawh a,’ la tîng a tih.

en: Then shall they also answer, saying, Lord, when saw we thee hungry, or athirst, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not minister unto thee?
hmr: Chu phâ chun, anni khawmin, ‘Lalpa, iengtik âm phîngṭâmin ama- nih, dangchârin amanih, mikhuolin amanih, intâng ina manih kan hmu che a, i rawng kan bâwlpêk naw che?’ tiin la dawn an tih.

en: Then shall he answer them, saying, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye did it not unto one of these least, ye did it not unto me.
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, ‘Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, hieng mi chîntak laia mi pakhat chunga in thaw naw chu ka chunga thaw naw in nih,’ tiin la dawn a tih.

en: And these shall go away into eternal punishment: but the righteous into eternal life.
hmr: Chun, chuonghai chu kumkhaw hremnaah fêng an ta, mi felhai ruok chu kumkhaw hringnaah fêng an tih,” a ta.
